user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of need_100_continue:
```c
static bool
need_100_continue (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  const char *expect;

  if (! MHD_IS_HTTP_VER_1_1_COMPAT (connection->rq.http_ver))
    return false;

  if (0 == connection->rq.remaining_upload_size)
    return false;

  if (MHD_NO ==
      MHD_lookup_connection_value_n (connection,
                                     MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                     MHD_HTTP_HEADER_EXPECT,
                                     MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ( \
                                       MHD_HTTP_HEADER_EXPECT),
                                     &expect,
                                     NULL))
    return false;

  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (expect,
                               "100-continue"))
    return true;

  return false;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (expect,
                               "100-continue"))
    return true;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: If MHD_lookup_connection_value_n returns an expect pointer that is not NUL-terminated (note the call passed NULL for the length), and MHD_str_equal_caseless_ is implemented using standard string.h functions that expect NUL-terminated strings (e.g. strcmp/strlen/strncasecmp/memcmp without length), the comparison can read past the bounds of the expect object. In that situation the code would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17.
